metadata.title: CVE-2016-8750 karaf: LDAP injection in LDAPLoginModule (moderate)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: Apache Karaf uses the LDAPLoginModule to authenticate users to a directory via LDAP. It does not, however, encode usernames properly and hence is vulnerable to LDAP injection attacks. While it appears that it is not possible to exploit this vulnerability to allow an attacker to gain remote access, it does allow an attacker to insert special characters into the search query step. Therefore, it can potentially be exploited as part of a Denial of Service attack.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 is installed
opendaylight is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
